verses.roman:
caitanya-mālīra kṛpā-jalera secane
sei jale puṣṭa skandha bāḍe dine dine

synonyms: caitanya-mālīra—of the gardener named Caitanya; kṛpā-jalera—of the water of His mercy; secane—by sprinkling; sei jale—by that water; puṣṭa—nourished; skandha—branches; bāḍe—increased; dine dine—day after day.
translation: Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu was also the gardener, and as He poured the water of His mercy on the tree, all the branches and subbranches grew, day after day.
